a.xlink:title: Node emptynode
Node node1 Youre in the ship again, drifting.

Node node2 You turn your ship around and fly straight back to Brachya, the most beautiful planet in space, and dock your ship at the port nearest the Royal Compound. After powering down the Cockleshell, you steel yourself and stride through the audience hall doors. The guards dont stop you; they know you for a loyal servant to Her Divine Crustaceasness, and they casually salute as you stride by.
a.text: You turn your ship around and fly straight back to

a.xlink:title: node1:march into that audience hall and tell Divine Brachyura that she's acting like a hermit crab

Node node3 You shift gears and push a few pertinent buttons, and your ship zips forward. Once again, you feel thankful that youve got a Cockleshell 2600. Cockleshells are produced on Emarginata, where they dont insist on sideways motion. Natas might be kind of odd, sure, but youd take one of their forward-motion ships any day of the week. It might be counterintuitive to say so (and youd never say it in front of Mother or Father, of course), but its nice to actually be able to see where youre going.
a.text: You shift gears and push a few pertinent buttons,

a.xlink:title: node1:something sparkles green and blue in the distance.

Node node4 You shift gears and jab a few pertinent buttons, and your ship drifts toward Verru, Sessilias second moon. Youd already programmed the Cockleshell to record the signal coming from the dark moon; now you set it to play the signal on the ships internal speakers. Perhaps you can learn something from it, even if the ships computer cant decode it.
a.text: You shift gears and jab a few pertinent buttons, a

a.xlink:title: node1:some kind of signal

Node node3A Your curiosity overwhelms you (and your good sense does not). You maintain your course toward the sparkling green and blue object and increase your speed. Youve come too far to turn back before finding out what this thing is! It could be incredible! It could be spectacular! If you turn back now, youll never know.
a.text: Your curiosity overwhelms you (and your good sense

a.xlink:title: node3:get closer

Node node3B With a sigh, you turn the ship around and head back the way youve come. Perhaps you should just go investigate that signal from Verru. You feel kind of silly—youre probably turning shell and running from a harmless gust of galactic gases—but, after all, there are lots of dangerous things in space. This sparkly blue and green whatsis could be one of them.
a.text: With a sigh, you turn the ship around and head bac

a.xlink:title: node3:turn around now

Node node3C Ooh, lunch time! You put the Cockleshell 2600 in neutral and let it idle, then reach around behind your seat and pull out your lunch pail. Mother filled it this morning as she does every morning, and you know youll find some tasty polyps and algae layered into the pound or so of sand. Tipping the pail up, you empty some sand into your mouth. Yes! Mmmmm, polyps! No one packs a lunch like Mother. You tip the pail up again.
a.text: Ooh, lunch time! You put the Cockleshell 2600 in n

a.xlink:title: node3:a nice coral polyp and algae sandwich

Node node4A Safety first! It only means pushing a button, after all. You cloak the ship, and its a damn good thing you did. Moments after cloaking, you see three ships come blazing toward you; you gape at them as they zip by and disappear into the distance. Judging by their speed and angle, theyve just come from Verru. You dont recognize the ships, so theyre obviously not of crustaceas design.
a.text: Safety first! It only means pushing a button, afte

a.xlink:title: node4:cloak the Cockleshell
Node node4B Cloak? No way. Theres no one out here! not a paranoid hermit crab.
a.text: Cloak? No way. There's no one out here! not a para

a.xlink:title: node4:there's nothing really going on out here
Node node3C1 20 seconds, give or take.
node3C:You can hold your breath for 20 seconds, give or take.
Node node3C2 3 minutes. Youve got training—Space Crab Army training.
a.text: 3 minutes. You've got training—Space Crab Army t

a.xlink:title: node3C:You can hold your breath for 3 minutes. You've got training—Space Crab Army training.
Node node3C3 Youre a space crab! You can hold your breath all day.
a.text: You're a space crab! You can hold your breath all

a.xlink:title: node3C:You're a space crab! You can hold your breath all day.

Node node3C2A This is no fantastic tale, you insist, leaning in toward Divine Brachyura, willing her to understand and believe. There are crabbers on Verru, and you must send out the Space Crab Army or else were all DOOMED!
a.text: "This is no fantastic tale," you insist, leaning i

a.xlink:title: node3C2:something you can say to convince her

Node node3C2B You shudder to think youll be living with your parents for the foreseeable future, but you know its pointless to argue with Divine Brachyura. You bow yourself out of her presence, apologizing profusely for bothering her.
a.text: You shudder to think you'll be living with your pa

a.xlink:title: node3C2:resign yourself to your fate

Node node4A1 After checking carefully with your ships scanners to make sure no more crabber vessels are nearby, you speed off toward Brachya. You plan out what to say to Divine Brachyura, envisioning yourself by her side as she announces that the crabbers have come and the Space Crab Army must arise and defeat the enemy.
a.text: After checking carefully with your ship's scanners

a.xlink:title: node4A:fly straight home, tell Divine Brachyura what you've seen, and help her raise the Space Crab Army

Node node4A2 Youre going to have to present Divine Brachyura with evidence that something fishy is going on with Verru, and the only way to do that is to go record some images with your handy wrist device. You wont actually have wrists when you use it, because youll be in crabform. You spend a moment pondering this irony, then take yourself firmly in claw. Youre stalling! Theres no time for nervous dithering. You tap out the proper commands and the Cockleshell sends you flying out through the airlock. Crabform kicks in immediately, turning you into an independent space-worthy unit, small but hardy.
a.text: You're going to have to present Divine Brachyura w

a.xlink:title: node4A:eject from the Cockleshell and go planetside to explore.
Node node4B1 You raise the ships shields and prepare to fire your xanthidaen lasers. Youre not going down without a fight!
a.text: You raise the ship's shields and prepare to fire y

a.xlink:title: Node node4B2 Theres no way the Cockleshell 2600 can handle a fight against three enemy ships. You desperately shift gears and send the Cockleshell flying homeward.
a.text: There's no way the Cockleshell 2600 can handle a f

a.xlink:title: Node node4A1A You agree with Divine Brachyura that you must be overtired, and you bow yourself out of her presence. Then you turn and scuttle for the Cockleshell, climbing inside and taking off before anyone can question you. None of the dock guards know youve been ordered home, anyway.
a.text: You agree with Divine Brachyura that you must be o

a.xlink:title: node4A1:sneak back into the Cockleshell 2600 and go get proof that the crabbers are on Verru

Node node4A1B Bowing deeply, you slowly head back down the audience hall toward the exit. Still in crabform—for the change hasnt yet had time to wear off—you clack toward home. Mother and Father will be out until evening, and you foresee a peaceful afternoon. In the empty kitchen, you prepare yourself a cup of strong tea and sip slowly, savoring the herbal flavor.
a.text: Bowing deeply, you slowly head back down the audie

a.xlink:title: node4A1:tea sounds like just the thing

Node node4A1A1 Oh, the horror! Rows and rows of monstrous silver pots, as far as the eye can see. Dozens of crabbers wander around inside the building, checking the pots, adding a dash of salt here and pepper there, filling ramekins with melted butter. Youve heard all the crabber campfire stories; you know what those pots are for.
a.text: Oh, the horror! Rows and rows of monstrous silver

a.xlink:title: node4A2:scuttle up to the nearest one, poking your head up to peer inside
node4A1A:scuttle over and take a peek
node4A1A:scuttle over and take a peek

Node node4A1A1A With the proof safely recorded on your wrist device, you scuttle off into the underbrush. When youve gotten a good distance away from the crabber encampment, you launch yourself back toward the Cockleshell 2600. Once aboard, you set your destination to Brachya and head home at the highest speed the Cockleshell can handle.
a.text: With the proof safely recorded on your wrist devic

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1:get out of here and take the Cockleshell back to Brachya
Node node4A1A1B You go on gawking like an idiot for some time, unable to tear your eyes away from what the crabbers are doing inside that horrifying room.
a.text: You go on gawking like an idiot for some time, una

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1:keep gawking like an idiot
Node node4A1A1A1 No, thats a terrible idea. Divine Brachyura doesnt have any patience for impertinence. You cant possibly confront her directly. You need to, or else.
a.text: No, that's a terrible idea. Divine Brachyura doesn

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A:protest her decision

Node node4A1A1A2 Though Divine Brachyura is no longer looking at you, you bow deeply and stalk out of the audience hall at a dignified pace. Outside, you see that the ships of the Space Crab Army are already arriving; Commander Kelpbane must have sent out the call as soon as he got Divine Brachyuras summons.
a.text: Though Divine Brachyura is no longer looking at yo

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A:sneak onto one of the ships

Node node4A1A1A3 Bowing deeply, you slowly head back down the audience hall toward the exit. Still in crabformófor the change hasnt yet had time to wear offóyou clack toward home. Mother and Father will be out until evening, and you foresee a peaceful afternoon. In the empty kitchen, you prepare yourself a cup of strong tea and sip slowly, savoring the herbal flavor.

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A:go home, have a nice cup of tea, and go to bed
node4A1A1A1:do some sneaking
node4A1A1A1:give up and go home
Node node4A1A1A2A You leap out from behind the gear rack, heedless of your own safety.

Node node4A1A1A2B You leap out from behind the gear rack, heedless of your own safety.
a.text: You leap out from behind the gear rack, heedless o

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A2:The deathstarfish

Node node4A1A1A2B1 Its not easy, but you claw your way back to consciousness. Whether your brilliant plan succeeds or not, youre going to see it through to the end. Youre going to stand proud, right here beside Divine Bra—...You glance around the cabin. Where did Divine Brachyura go? You boggle when you see her heading for the hatch. She glances back and catches your eye.
a.text: It's not easy, but you claw your way back to consc

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A2:fight your way back to awareness

Node node4A1A1A2B1A Yes! It appears to be turning toward the moon. As you watch the screen, the deathstarfish seems to pulsate from within. When the beam of energy erupts from its...mouth, perhaps, if thats its mouth...and slams into Verru, you gasp. What had been a moon just a moment before has instantly become scraps and debris, through which the deathstarfish is cheerfully skimming. You imagine it burbling happily to itself; it reminds you of your pet hamster, burrowing through a pile of food pellets and seeds.
a.text: Yes! It appears to be turning toward the moon. As

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A2:Will the monstrous creature turn its attention to Verru?
Node node4A1A1A2B1A1 You run after Divine Brachyura, determined to get your due.
a.text: You run after Divine Brachyura, determined to get

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A2:make that hermit crab of a Brachyura (Divine! Pah!) acknowledge you in front of everyone
Node node4A1A1A2B1A2 shut your trap, have a good time and a long life, THE END
a.text: shut your trap, have a good time and a long life,

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A2:keep your trap shut and join the party, which is clearly getting underway as you stand around moping. You see a huge barrel of ale being rolled down the street, and a few crabs have already started singing a victory song.

Node node4A1A1A2B2 You let yourself drift into oblivion, hoping that when you wake up everything will be taken care of: the deathstarfish will have eaten Verru, the crabbers will be gone, and Divine Brachyura will have had someone drag you home to bed.
a.text: You let yourself drift into oblivion, hoping that

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A2:sleep through whatever's going to happen next

Node node4A1A1A2C You burst from your hiding place, startling Divine Brachyura long enough to grab the mic out of her sturdy claw. Clearing your throat, you burst into a full-throated rendition of the Brachyuran National Anthem:
a.text: You burst from your hiding place, startling Divine

a.xlink:title: node4A1A1A2:lead them in song.
